009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.utils;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.mod;
012import static java.lang.Math.PI;
013
014import java.util.Random;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
018
019/**
020 * Defines utility methods for picking random points on a given circle.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 *
024 */
025public class CircleSampler {
026        
027        private final Random rg;        
028        private final GeometricCircle circle;
029        
030        public CircleSampler(GeometricCircle circle) {
031                this.circle = circle;
032                this.rg = new Random();
033        }
034        
035        public CircleSampler(GeometricCircle circle, long seed) {
036                this.circle = circle;
037                this.rg = new Random(seed);
038        }
039        
040        /**
041         * Creates and returns an array of 2D points sampled on 
042         * the circle associated with this {@link CircleSampler}.
043         * Random Gaussian noise (with standard deviation sigma)
044         * is added to the individual x/y coordinates.
045         *
046         * @param n          number of points to sample
047         * @param startAngle initial angle (in radians)
048         * @param endAngle   final angle (in radians)
049         * @param sigma      sigma of Gaussian noise
050         * @return an array of sample points
051         */
052        public Pnt2d[] getPoints(int n, double startAngle, double endAngle, double sigma) {
053                double xc = circle.xc;
054                double yc = circle.yc;
055                double r = circle.r;
056                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[n];
057                
058                startAngle = mod(startAngle, 2 * PI);
059                endAngle = mod(endAngle, 2 * PI);
060                double dAngle = (endAngle >= startAngle) ? 
061                                (endAngle - startAngle) :
062                                (endAngle + 2 * PI - startAngle);
063                
064                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
065                        double alpha = startAngle + dAngle * i / n;
066                        double x = xc + r * Math.cos(alpha) + sigma * rg.nextGaussian();
067                        double y = yc + r * Math.sin(alpha) + sigma * rg.nextGaussian();
068                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.from(x, y);
069                }
070                return pts;
071        }
072
073}
